channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How one tech startup is giving cash to SNAP recipients
item.description: Propel makes a free app for people on food stamps. Now it's giving some of them $50 each, as some private companies, nonprofits, and individuals scram...

item.title: From California to NYC: 4 races to watch this Election Day
item.description: Four races highlight this year's elections: a redistricting referendum in California, governor's races in New Jersey and Virginia and the mayoral cont...

item.title: Searching 'weight' can bring up Ozempic in results. It's a drug advertising loophole
item.description: There are strict rules about what drug companies can say in TV or print ads. But a new study shows there's a lot more wiggle room when companies pay t...

item.title: When SNAP benefits will arrive is still in flux. Here's what communities are doing to fill the gap
item.description: Reporters from the NPR Network are covering the uncertainty and lapse in benefits in states across the country.

item.title: A Planet Money Guide To Five Fascinating Economic Studies
item.description: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economic studies.

item.title: Trump’s strength, Democrats’ message and the shutdown effect. What to watch on Election Day 2025
Polls open in NYC mayoral race - here are five things to watch in US elections
item.description: Though President Donald Trump is not on the ballot, his agenda looms large over the races in New York City, New Jersey, and Virginia.

item.title: Guinea's coup leader enters presidential race
item.description: Gen Mamadi Doumbouya has broken his promise to hand power to a civilian government.

item.title: 11/3: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: NYC mayoral candidates make final push ahead of Election Day; New CBS News poll reveals how Democrats view socialism.

item.title: Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful and polarizing vice presidents of US history, dies at 84
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney has died at age 84. The hard-charging conservative became one of the most powerful and polarizing vice presidents an...

item.title: Mamdani and Cuomo face off as New York City chooses new mayor, while Sliwa hopes for an upset
Will Ferrell's "Elf" suit and Boba Fett's blaster set to hit the auction block
item.description: An auction house is set to take bids on some iconic Hollywood memorabilia, from the suit worn by the "Elf" himself, to Marty McFly's hoverboard.

item.title: Delhi's lonely African elephant was killed by rare rodent-borne virus
item.description: Shankar, a 29-year-old male elephant, died in September after spending much of his life in isolation.

item.title: Trump backs Cuomo for New York City mayor and threatens to cut funding if Mamdani wins
item.description: Opinion polls suggest left-wing candidate Zohran Mamdani is ahead of former state governor Andrew Cuomo for Tuesday’s race.

item.title: 13 suspected drug cartel members killed in shootout with police
item.description: Four suspects were arrested and nine people kidnapped by the gang were freed following the clash in Sinaloa, officials said.

item.title: Dick Cheney, powerful and controversial former vice president, dies at 84
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a force in Republican politics for over 30 years and one of the most powerful people to hold the second-highest off...

item.title: Supreme Court prepares to weigh tariffs fight in test of Trump's power
item.description: The Supreme Court will consider Wednesday whether a federal emergency powers law gives President Trump the authority to impose his most sweeping tarif...

item.title: Worker dies after partial collapse of medieval tower in Rome
item.description: The man was trapped for several hours after part of the Torre dei Conti, on the edge of the Roman Forum, gave way.
